intro: Syntrichopappus, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by their low-growing, mat-forming structure. They possess small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and are adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Syntrichopappus species play a role in stabilizing sandy soils and are often used in ecological restoration projects.
